definition: growing flowers
to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
surname Hua

sentences.english: The flower plant has overgrown its support.
sentences.chinese: 盆養花長得極高，超出了支架。

sentences.english: At my spare time I also grow flowers.
sentences.chinese: 業餘時間我還喜歡養花。

sentences.english: The climate of Beijing is not fit for growing flowers.
sentences.chinese: 北京的氣候，對養花來說，不算很好。

sentences.english: Aviculture plant flowers in almost every household, life is full of fun.
sentences.chinese: 幾乎家家戶戶都養花養鳥，生活充滿情趣。

sentences.english: We bedded up the dirt for raising flowers.
sentences.chinese: 我們堆土成花壇以養花。

sentences.english: So. The plant is just practice for raising a child?
sentences.chinese: 那麼說，養花是養孩子的練習啦？

sentences.english: She is particularly keep on nuturing the flowers.
At that time, my father very much like the flower-growing.
sentences.chinese: 那時候，我的父親非常喜歡養花。

sentences.english: I love flowers, so I love to grow them.
He takes up gardening after his retirement.
sentences.chinese: 退休後他以養花種草作爲消遣。

definition: to grow flowers/floriculture
to practice writing characters
brocade garments, jade meals (idiom); a life of luxury/extravagance
to chat
to play or strum a lute or other stringed instrument
lit. firewood, rice, oil, salt, soy, vinegar, and tea/fig. life's daily necessities
pinyin: chai2 mi3 you2 yan2 jiang4 cu4 cha2

definition: to find amusement in one's own way/to enjoy oneself quietly
talent and learning/scholarship
gardener
to go on a scenic tour
to recite or chant Buddhist scripture
to neglect sleep and forget about food (idiom)/to skip one's sleep and meals/to be completely wrapped up in one's work
(idiom) (of a good outcome) unanticipated/serendipitous/fortuitous
all one's hopes and efforts come to nothing/futile
lucky bamboo (Dracaena sanderiana)
to show respect from a distance (idiom)/to remain at a respectful distance
